Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells were used for stable overexpression of wild type and mutant a-Syn.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of a-Syn A30P mutant was confirmed by Western blot analysis.
Expression of a-Syn A53T mutant was confirmed by Western blot analysis.
Expression of a-Syn E46K mutant was confirmed by Western blot analysis.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected and mock-transfected SH-SY5Y cells served as controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Detection of a 19 kDa band corresponding to a-Syn protein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence of a 19 kDa band corresponding to a-Syn protein.

Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells were used for stable overexpression of wild type and mutant a-Syn.

Readout description.Result Description: Bright fluorescence staining confirmed expression of a-Syn A30P mutant.
Bright fluorescence staining confirmed expression of a-Syn A53T mutant.
Bright fluorescence staining confirmed expression of a-Syn E46K mutant.

Basic negative control.Description: Untransfected and mock-transfected SH-SY5Y cells served as controls.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Bright and evenly distributed fluorescence staining for a-Syn.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Absence or weak fluorescence staining for a-Syn.

Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells were subjected to acute rotenone and maneb treatment.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant showed significantly lower cell viability following rotenone and maneb treatment compared to untransfected cells.
A53T mutant showed significantly lower cell viability following rotenone and maneb treatment compared to untransfected cells.
E46K mutant showed significantly lower cell viability following rotenone and maneb treatment compared to untransfected cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Data are expressed as means ± S.E.M of 3 independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA was used for statistical analysis with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability comparable to or higher than untransfected untreated cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly lower cell viability compared to untransfected untreated cells (p < 0.05).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: MTT Assay (Chronic Toxin Treatment with H2O2 Insult)

Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells were subjected to chronic rotenone and maneb treatment followed by acute H2O2 insult.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant showed significantly lower cell viability following chronic maneb treatment and H2O2 insult compared to untransfected cells.
A53T mutant showed significantly lower cell viability following chronic maneb treatment and H2O2 insult compared to untransfected cells.
E46K mutant showed lower cell viability following chronic treatment and H2O2 insult compared to untransfected cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Data are expressed as means ± S.E.M of 3 independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA was used for statistical analysis with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell viability comparable to or higher than untransfected untreated cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly lower cell viability compared to untransfected untreated cells (p < 0.05).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Flow Cytometry (ROS Generation and Mitochondrial Membrane Potential)

Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma SH-SY5Y cells were subjected to acute and chronic toxin treatments followed by staining for ROS and mitochondrial membrane potential.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant showed increased ROS levels and greater mitochondrial membrane potential disruption compared to controls.
A53T mutant showed increased ROS levels and greater mitochondrial membrane potential disruption compared to controls.
E46K mutant showed increased ROS levels and greater mitochondrial membrane potential disruption compared to controls.

Biological replicates.Description: Data are expressed as means ± S.E.M of 3 independent experiments.

Basic negative control.Description: Untreated untransfected cells served as control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA was used for statistical analysis with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: ROS levels and mitochondrial membrane potential comparable to untransfected untreated cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly higher ROS levels or greater mitochondrial membrane potential disruption compared to untransfected untreated cells (p < 0.05).
